reviewText: I swear this version is so much better than Cardcraptors. I've had experience before with it around a year ago, and let me tell you, it's totally not true anime compared to this. Diolouge was changed, scenes were cut where there were funny parts {anime should at least be funny, but that can't be accomplished with Cardcraptors}, and even whole episodes were cut!!! Hard to believe but it's true. Thank You so much Pioneer for releasing Cardcaptor Sakura as a japanese series, I love it like that.In the first episode:This episode takes place during the summer, and Sakura's class is currently attending the beach. There, they have some cool activities, including a test of courage in a cave. But why does everyone inside the cave disappear? Ep.17 CARDCAPTOR SAKURA-SAKURA'S SCARY TEST OF COURAGE.In the second episode:Sakura, Tomoyo, Toya, and Yukito go to a festival at a shrine. But what afe the weird dancing lights that create a romantic scene between Sakura and Yukito? Is it a Clow Card? Ep.18 CARDCAPTOR SAKURA- SAKURA, YUKITO, AND THE SUMMER FESTIVAL.In the third episode:This episode takes place at the end of summer vacation. I hope Sakura learns a valuable lesson that you should not put your homework off until the last minute. Sakura's main concern seems to be finishing her book report, but the book keeps moving thanks to a Clow Card. Ep.19 CARDCAPTOR SAKURA-SAKURA AND THE SUMMER HOLIDAY HOMEWORK.In the fourth episode:Sharon's cousin, Meilin Li, transfers from Honk Kong to Japan, and is...going to attend his school!! It's very obviuos that she doesn't like Sakura all that much. Meanwhile, a girl wearing mysterious clothing is challenging black-belt karates. Is it a Clow Card? Ep.20 CARDCAPTOR SAKURA-TRANSFER STUDENT VERSUS SAKURA.Highly Recommended.
summary: I laughed, which cannot be done with Cardcraptors.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Cardcaptor Sakura: Vacation Daze: Vol. 5 continues the story of young Sakura Kinomoto and her quest to capture all of the magical Clow Cards.  With the help of Kero, the "winged lion" guardian of the seal that Sakura broke on the cards, and her rival Li Shaoran, Sakura is put to many tests.Just a wonderful series, as appealing to adults as children.  The DVD's are not dubbed in English; only English subtitles and Japanese dialouge are available.Volume 5 contains four episodes, which take place during summer vacation from school.Episode 17: "Sakura's Scary Test of Courage" - Sakura goes on a summer trip to the beach with her classmates, but it turns into a test of courage as a "ghost" is scaring vacationers out of their wits.  Is a Clow Card behind this?  Will Sakura be able to overcome her paralyzing fear of spirits to get to the bottom of the mystery?Episode 18: "Sakura, Yukito, and the Summer Festival" - Sakura has a chance to go to a summer festival with her older brother's dreamy friend Yukito.  Sakura has a big crush on Yukito.  Li Shaoran also wants Yukito's attention (as a friend/big brother), and this provides many amusing moments.  Everyone dons yukatas (summer kimonos) and enjoys the fair.  This episode has the gentlest card and the gentlest capture of the series.  Quite lovely.Episode 19: "Sakura's Summer Vaction Homework" - In Japan, kids are apparently given all kinds of projects to do over vacation that must be turned in the first day of school.  Sakura has put it off until the last day.  She goes to the library to look for a book, but Li is after it too.  Something funny about the way the book keeps moving around . . .Episode 20: "The New Exchange Student" - Another student arrives from Hong Kong.  She is Mei Lin, and she claims to be Li's fiancee, although he seems none too happy about it.  She is instantly jealous of Sakura.  But will Mei Lin's martial arts skills come in handy when the Fight Card is attacking and defeating martial artists in the city?  This is one of my favorite episodes.  The fight card is so cool, as are all the action scenes.

reviewText: Yes, it's volume 5 instead of volume 4. So what? The series *does* consist mainly of filler episodes, after all. Please buy this to show Pioneer that even with volume 4 being delayed until after volumes 5 and 6, this excellent show still has strong support.
summary: It's volume 5 instead of volume 4, but what difference?

reviewText: Well, it was sort of a long wait, but this disc was DEFINITELY worth it!  For now we know what really happened when Meilin arrived!For this disc's first offering, an episode that made the dub - the capturing of the Erase card while the kids are at Outdoor Studies(read: Summer Camp). There's a small scene at the front with Kero complaining about the heat in Sakura's room, but otherwise what we see in the dub was basically what happened in the Japanese. (Remember: Some dialogue changes are unavoidable due to that amzing thing called LIP MOVEMENT!!)Second up, the gang's off to a small street fair/festival, in kimonos!! (Except Li, the kimonos I mean.) The capture of the Glow card is secondary to the fun of Li and Toya having a Ring Booth battle to get a bunny for Sakura(and..Yukito).Third on the agenda, the capture of the Move card, which jumps into a book that both Sakura AND Li need for a book report, leading them on a merry game of "Catch Me If You Can!" At the end of the episode Meilin makes her hysterical entrance, arriving at Li and Wei(the guy who's looking after him while he's here, and now Meilin as well[that's right, the rest of their families stayed in Hong Kong, as apposed to the commentary of Meilin's father being transferred in the dub!])'s apartment. The timing is especially interesting as Sakura and Tomoyo are present when she arrives(you'll have to watch to find out why.), and she is not at all pleased to find two other girls in Li's home! Especially when one is wearing...well, like I said, buy it and find out for yourself.For our final offering, another ep. that made the dub, the capture of the Fight card. The Japanese version is way worth it, as we have a scene deleted from the dub wherein Sakura recalls how Meilin "asked" her and Tomoyo to leave her and Li's apartment after the end of the previous episode. And let's get one thing clear here: Meilin and Li are cousins, and (as I understand it from other sources, subject to change with later discs) Meilin is Li's fiancee by parental arrangement! She even states this rather emphatically to Sakura in this episode when she's introduced to the class!I laughed til I died, then was resucitated and laughed some more! Let the next one come!Scorpinac
